title: 道德經
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.zh: 三十輻，共一轂，當其無，有車之用。
passages.en: (The use of what has no substantive existence) The thirty spokes unite in the one nave; but it is on the empty space (for the axle), that the use of the wheel depends.

passages.zh: 埏埴以為器，當其無，有器之用。
passages.en: Clay is fashioned into vessels; but it is on their empty hollowness, that their use depends.

passages.zh: 鑿戶牖以為室，當其無，有室之用。
passages.en: The door and windows are cut out (from the walls) to form an apartment; but it is on the empty space (within), that its use depends.

passages.zh: 故有之以為利，無之以為用。
passages.en: Therefore, what has a (positive) existence serves for profitable adaptation, and what has not that for (actual) usefulness.
